sen.j: 一色 義秀（いっしき よしひで、？ - 明応7年5月29日 (旧暦)（1498年6月18日））は室町時代後期の守護大名。
sen.e: Yoshihide ISSHIKI (? - June 18, 1498) was a shugo daimyo (a Japanese territorial lord as a provincial constable) who lived in the latter of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 原文では西暦で1498年6月18日没となりますが、これは明応7年5月29日をユリウス暦に換算したものであり、現代で用いられているグレゴリオ暦では1498年6月27日です。ただし翻訳文は原文にある通りの6月18日を採用してます。
sen.e: Yoshihide ISSHIKI (? - June 18, 1498) was a shugo daimyo (a Japanese territorial lord as a provincial constable) who lived in the latter of the Muromachi period.

sen.e: In 1484, since his elder brother named Yoshiharu ISSHIKI died suddenly, he unpremeditatedly succeeded to the Isshiki clan.

sen.e: In August 1486, his father Yoshinao lost his fief Obama in Wakasa Province due to the Imperial Court's intention, and this place was given to Kuninobu TAKEDA, who was the shugo of this province.

sen.e: This made Yoshinao enraged and he immediately went away from the metropolis into Tango Province, and he did not even join in the suppression of Takayori ROKKAKU, which was carried out by Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA in the following year (in 1487).

sen.j: 明応2年（1493年）、丹後では伊賀次郎左衛門が叛乱を起こし、上洛していた父義直も急を聞いて丹後に下向、親子で鎮圧に当たったらしい。
sen.e: In 1493, once Jirosaemon IGA raised a rebellion in Tango Province, his father Yoshinao, who was in the metropolis at that moment, also left there for Tango Province due to this urgent news, and it is said that the father and the son worked together to suppress the rebellion.

sen.j: その後も丹後では国衆の叛乱が相次ぎ、遂に明応7年（1498年）5月29日、義秀は丹後国普甲山で国衆に攻められ自害して果てた。
sen.e: After that, rebellions by kunishu (local samurais) occurred repeatedly in Tango Province, and Yoshihide eventually killed himself in Mt. Fuko in Tango Province on June 18, 1498, during the attack from the kunishu.
